articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor 7th in C# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in C# (Shape: A)

## Description
An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played one after the other rather than simultaneously. In this case, the arpeggio is based on a Minor 7th chord in the key of C# with the specific shape of A.

## Notes and Intervals
The Minor 7th arpeggio in C# consists of the notes C# (root), E (minor third), G# (fifth), and B (minor seventh). This creates a dark and jazzy sound due to the minor tonality and the added minor 7th interval.

## Genre and Flavor
The Minor 7th arpeggio is commonly used in jazz, blues, R&B, and funk music genres. It adds a smooth and sophisticated flavor to chord progressions and melodies, enhancing the emotional depth and complexity of the music.

## Example Songs
1. "Blue Bossa" by Kenny Dorham
2. "Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra
3. "Ain't No Sunshine" by Bill Withers
